intro: Sebastiania argutidens, commonly known as the hollyleaf sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stems. It produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique fruiting structures.
